page.title: 11Farming in East Huntspill
page.content: The farm is 185 years old and covers 90 acres on which 85 beef cattle and 200 sheep are raised. In the summer the cows eat grass and in winter they eat hay and cow cake.The food for the animals comes by lorry from Bradfords.In the morning the farmers get up at 6.30 and finish their working day at 6.45pm.In summer they finish at 11.00 at night because of hay making. In addition to farming,the owners make jam, chutney, and cakes. They have a camping site and a farm shop for the campers.The shop opens from 8.30am to 10.00am and it opens again at 5.30pm till 7.00pm.
